alert.note: Alert for Fond Du Lac; Sheboygan (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 9:18PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ozaukee, eastern Fond du Lac, northern Washington, northern Dodge and Sheboygan Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 917 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Brillion to St Anna to near Oakfield to near Beaver Dam. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sheboygan, Fond Du Lac, West Bend, Beaver Dam, Port Washington, Plymouth, Sheboygan Falls, Mayville, Saukville, Kewaskum, Horicon, Howards Grove, Juneau, Oostburg, Lomira, Belgium, Fredonia, Kohler, Cedar Grove, and Campbellsport. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 151 between mile markers 128 and 144, between mile markers 162 and 163, and between mile markers 165 and 167. Interstate 43 between mile markers 97 and 135. Interstate 41 between mile markers 71 and 96. U.S. Highway 45 between mile markers 68 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Wisconsin.
